fields.description:
Users without the _confluence-administrators_ membership cannot add labels when editing existing Page templates.

*Steps to reproduce:*
1. log in as a regular user;
2. edit an existing Page Template;
3. click *Labels* - an error message will be displayed
!template_label1.png|thumbnail!
4. start typing an existing label - it will be recognized
!template_label2.png|thumbnail!
5. select the label from the autocomplete dropdown - another error will occur
!template_label3.png|thumbnail!



+Notes:+ 
- this behaviour isn't changed by any of the Confluence Global or Space Permissions;
- no errors occur when adding labels to a new Template.

As a result, users would need help from Support whenever they want to add a label to a Template.
fields.summary: Users cannot add labels to Page Templates

fields.description:
h3. ***Summary***
Having a heading level that is inconsistent and using the Display Section Numbering will cause the macro to fail with the following error.
{code}
Error rendering macro 'toc' : null
{code}

h3. ***Steps to Reproduce***
# Create a page
# Add a header with *level 2*
# Add another header with *level 2*
# Add a header with *level 1*
# Add a table of contents macro at the top of the page
# Tick *Display Section Numbering*
# Refresh macro to preview, it will display the mentioned error

{panel}***Note*: 
(x) The steps can be repeated with the following header level which causes the same error
# Add a header with *level 3*
# Add a header with *level 1*
# Add a header with *level 2*

(/) If the steps are repeated with the following header levels, the macro works fine.
# Add a header with *level 3*
# Add a header with *level 2*
# Add a header with *level 1*
{panel}

h3. ***Workaround*** 
- Change the header level to a more consistent level
- Do not use *Display Section Numbering* for the table of content
fields.summary: Inconsistent Heading Level Causes and Using Display Section Numbering Will Cause the Macro to Fail

fields.description:
It does not make sense for new users to see this dialog since everything is new to them.

I was not able to reproduce this on BTF. I wasn't able to popup the dialog at all in BTF (The Confluence What's New add-on was enabled).

fields.description:
The Next Hint tooltip is always cut off:

!hint.png!

And the Page Restrictions tooltip is cut off at smaller window widths when the "Unrestricted", "Attachments", and "Labels" buttons are shrunk to only their icon (no text):

!restrictions.png!

Occurs in all browsers.
fields.summary: "Next Hint" and "Page Restrictions" tooltips in the editor are cut off

fields.description:
While automating the task of updating a page in Confluence I came across an issue that gave me an impression the service was down when it actuality it had to do with the service taking too much time to process a request and failing.

I had a page that had a good hundred {{{color:gray}some text{color}}} references in it and while uploading it via the XMLRPC interface it constantly failed with an HTTP 504 error. As soon as I removed those or replaced them by other text effect, the issue went away.

Was wondering if there was any inefficiencies in processing that instruction that could be corrected.
fields.summary: Submitting too many {color} macro references on a page edit via XMLRPC interface causes an HTTP 504 (Gateway Timeout)

fields.description:
Actual error: formatDates(startDate, endDate, format) is being called everywhere, but the function is formatDates(format, startDate, endDate).

Lines on master are: 
* function definition at fullcalendar.js:214
* actual failing call (but there are more like this one) at fullcalendar.js:5847
fields.summary: Inconsistency in the method signature of formatDates() in fullcalendar.js:

fields.description:
Since Icebat 71.1 (JIRA 6.1-OD-08) Users in OnDemand are only being able to create project links from JIRA to Confluence if they belong to the *confluence-administrators* group. 

The problem is that membership to that specific group is restricted to the Atlassian *sysadmin* user only, blocking regular administrators users from creating Project Links.
fields.summary: In OnDemand, only users in confluence-administrators can create Project Links from JIRA to Confluence.

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Users are unable to set site Homepage of their Confluence instances because the system throws an error stating that the target space must be accessible to the confluence-users group.

On a JIRA + Confluence OnDemand instance, there is no confluence-users group configured by default, just the users group.

See attached image:

!general_configuration.png!

h3. Workaround

Create a group called confluence-users, grant view permission to this group on the target space. Then, you'll be able to set the space as the site Homepage

P.S.: No need to add users on the new confluence-users group as well. Just make sure that users are inside the users group and that it has view permission on the same space.
fields.summary: Unable to set site Homepage unless the space is accessible to the confluence-users group

fields.description:
Cases for dates, ISBNs and hyphen separated phone numbers have been fixed. Issue still persists for patterns matching strings in the form of JIRA issue keys i.e. XX-9.
h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a new blank page on Confluence OnDemand and type a string with at least two alphabetical characters, and at least one number separated by a dash - E.G. "UTF-8".
#- During the edition, the text is normal.
# Hit the _preview_ or direct _save_ the page and the text separated by hyphens will become a hyperlink, see this [screenshot|^screenshot2.png].
#- The hyperlink in this page will point to https://<base_url>/browse/UTF-8 which is not a valid URL

h4. Fix notes
* Issue is caused in instances with JIRA app link. JIRA App link URL patterns are matched using regex alone which is insufficient.
* The same behavior doesn't occur on the same version of Confluence Standalone.
* One difference that was observed between OnDemand and Standalone is that on OnDemand there is by default a plugin called _Application Links_, see this [screenshot|^PluginsOnDemand.png].
* On Confluence Standalone this plugin doesn't exist by default, see this [screenshot|^PluginsStandalone.png]
fields.summary: Dashed word in Confluence OnDemand automatically creates a link to a non-existent JIRA issue
Confluence Page Gadget on Confluence shows "The resource https://instancename.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/quickreload/latest/undefined?since=<ID>, cannot be found."

fields.description:
If a page has been set to view only anonymous access and has a gliffy diagram a user is able to go into the diagram and edit it, but not save. To reproduce:
1. Visit an anonymous access granted confluence page with a gliffy diagram
2. Click Tools then Attachments
3. Click Edit and play around with the diagram, if you attempt to save you are directed to a page that does not exist/permission denied
fields.summary: Anonymous users with view only permissions can edit Gliffy diagrams

fields.description:
When applying a text style (e.g. Heading1) to a macro, the macro's content is formatted with that style as if it were plain text.
h4. Steps to reproduce
# Insert a macro into a page (e.g. Team Calendars)
# Still in edit mode, click the inserted macro and change text style to 'Heading1' in the toolbar
# Save

h4. Examples
* _Team Calendars macro with *'paragraph'* text style:_
!TC1.png!

* _Team Calendars macro with *'Heading1'* text style:_
!TC2.png!

* _User List macro using *'paragraph'* text style, and then *'Heading1'*:_
!UL.png!
fields.summary: Text style is affecting macros' content

fields.description:
It is not possible to import a 15GB Confluence backup with attachments created on v5.2 OD13 on another OnDemand Confluence Standalone instance with the same version.

{color:red}Import works correctly on a Confluence OnDemand v5.2 OD13 running locally.{color}

*Error shown when importing:*
{noformat}
... ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "cp_unique_group"
{noformat}

*Note:* The backup was created from a Jira + Confluence instance

*To replicate:*
1. Start test instance (if not active already) (it has ram extended to 768MB to avoid NotEnoughMemory)
2. Log in and try to Import Site using file Confluence-backup-20130807.zip

*What I did:*
1. Created a new OnDemand instance Confluence Standalone (icebat-54.0 to match customers)
2. provide it more ram (it will fail because of NotEnoughMemory if not) using [this documentation|https://sdog.jira.com/wiki/display/JST/2013/07/01/The+new+way+to+customise+OnDemand+instances]:
* edit the /data/icebat/local.yaml file and add the following line: confluence::max_heap: "768m"
* run: /sw/studio/$(cat /data/icebat/version)/install/install-confluence-standalone.sh

3. moved the file to the new instance using [a script|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ONDEMANDKB/Can't+Download+Large+Files+from+OnDemand+WebDAV] to avoid disconnections
4. verified md5
5. tried to import through the Import Site section.

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce
# In an OnDemand JIRA+Confluence, create a group called something like "TEST-$\{KEY}".
# Manually trigger Confluence to sync with Crowd.

This stack trace appears in the logs:

{code:none}
2013-04-12 02:58:44,605 ERROR [scheduler_Worker-7] [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingDirectoryPoller] pollChanges Error occurred while refreshing the cache for directory [ 65537 ].
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: can't parse argument number KEY
      at java.text.MessageFormat.makeFormat(MessageFormat.java:1339)
      at java.text.MessageFormat.applyPattern(MessageFormat.java:458)
      at java.text.MessageFormat.<init>(MessageFormat.java:350)
      at java.text.MessageFormat.format(MessageFormat.java:811)
      at com.atlassian.crowd.util.TimedOperation.complete(TimedOperation.java:18)
      at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DirectoryCacheImplUsingChangeOperations.syncUserMembersForGroup(DirectoryCacheImplUsingChangeOperations.java:124)
      at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.AbstractCacheRefresher.synchroniseMemberships(AbstractCacheRefresher.java:145)
      at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.AbstractCacheRefresher.synchroniseAll(AbstractCacheRefresher.java:84)
      at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.EventTokenChangedCacheRefresher.synchroniseAll(EventTokenChangedCacheRefresher.java:59)
      at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory.synchroniseCache(DbCachingRemoteDirectory.java:622)
      at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectorySynchroniserImpl.synchronise(DirectorySynchroniserImpl.java:63)
      at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingDirectoryPoller.pollChanges(DbCachingDirectoryPoller.java:50)
      at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.monitor.poller.DirectoryPollerJobBean.executeInternal(DirectoryPollerJobBean.java:29)
      at org.springframework.scheduling.quartz.QuartzJobBean.execute(QuartzJobBean.java:86)
      at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:199)
      at com.atlassian.confluence.schedule.quartz.ConfluenceQuartzThreadPool$1.run(ConfluenceQuartzThreadPool.java:20)
      at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:549)
{code}

From that point forward, any changes made to groups or users in JIRA won't end up flowing through to Crowd.

JIRA and Crowd itself both handle this group quite happily, Confluence should be able to as well.
fields.summary: Groups with special characters cause Confluence to stop syncing with Crowd

fields.description:
h3. Problem

The page which is restricted to user A only is shown on the page tree and the left sidebar when the page is at the top level of the page tree which is at the same level at the home page.

This is replicable on my dev instance.
# Create a test space.
# Create Page A and make sure the location is at the top layer of the space.
# Create Page B and restricted to sysadmin only and again make sure the location is set at the top layer of the space.
# Configure sidebar to show in page tree
# Log in with a user with only confluence-user permission.

When the user access Page A, he will be able to see Page B appear at the page tree at the sidebar but when he click at the link, the page with error message {{You do not have permission to view this page. Request access below, you will receive an email when you've been granted access.}} will shown.

h3. Workaround
Configure sidebar to use *child pages* as navigation display instead.
Use a *Home Page* as a top layer for all the pages.
fields.summary: Restricted page at the Home Page layer is shown at the sidebar page tree
Incorrect English usage on About Page

fields.description:
If you configure the Live Search macro option to Restrict to label(s) and Type = comments, then no results are displayed.

Further, if the user clicks through to Search page, then the filter parameters aren't passed through (it defaults to all types). However, you can't filter by label in Search anyway.

The use case for this configuration is to provide the ability to search comments on a single page or across a set of related pages (using the label to restrict to one or more specific pages).
fields.summary: Live Search option restrict to label conflicts with type if set to comments

Sends you to https://users/editmyprofilepicture.action.

fields.description:
h4.Steps to reproduce

# Go to a space that contains pages with Lucid Charts
# Go to Browse > Space Operations
# Click on Export - PDF
# Select the Custom Export radio button
# Check one or more pages which contains Lucid Charts
# Click on Export button
# Download the PDF

h4.Issue

Instead of having the chart, each of them are replaced by:

*Error: Unable to retrieve macro content from Remotable Plugin 'Lucidchart': The validated object is null*

See attached file as the result.

*P.S.:* If you export a single page through its 'Tools > Export to PDF', it works fine.

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Generate an XML backup of a Confluence instance that has Team Calendars (TC) installed
** TC doesn't have to be being used or even have a licence, just be enabled.
** Because TC is installed & enabled on it, the source instance will have a bandana entry in the DB that has
*** a {{bandanacontext}} of "_CALENDAR_ee65026d81383713d11480a2da8ced1608ea1448", and
*** a {{bandanakey}} of "legacySubCalendarsMigrationCutoffDate".
# Attempt to import this backup into an Confluence-only OnDemand instance using the "Import site" feature.

h4. Expected result 

The import should complete successfully.

h4. Actual result

The import fails with the following error message:
{quote}Import failed. Check your server logs for more information.

com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: Unable to complete import because the data does not match the constraints in the Confluence schema.

Cause: PSQLException: ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "bandana_unique_key"{quote}

h4. Workaround

The problem seems to centre around this "legacySubCalendarsMigrationCutoffDate" {{bandanakey}} when it exists in both the source and destination instances (i.e. if they both have the TC plugin installed, which all OnDemand instances do).

The site import will succeed if the following SQL is run on the destination instance immediately before the import:
{code:sql}
DELETE FROM bandana WHERE bandanacontext='_CALENDAR_ee65026d81383713d11480a2da8ced1608ea1448' AND bandanakey='legacySubCalendarsMigrationCutoffDate';
{code}

However, OnDemand customers cannot run arbitrary SQL on their instances, so this is not an acceptable workaround (unless Support is guiding them through the import process).

They could probably delete the offending entry from the {{entities.xml}} file inside their backup zip, but I haven't tested this.
fields.summary: OnDemand site importer fails to import backups from instances that have Team Calendars installed

fields.summary: User List macro broken in Confluence 5.1-OD-3

fields.description:
The affected methods are:

AddOrRemoveGadgetSpecAction, doAdd
AddOrRemoveGadgetSpecAction, doRemove
AddOrRemoveGadgetFeedAction, doAddGadgetFeed
AddOrRemoveGadgetFeedAction, doRemoveGadgetFeed
WhitelistAdminAction, doAddWhitelistUrl
WhitelistAdminAction, doRemoveWhitelistUrl
RevokeOAuthTokensAction, execute

I'm proposing to leave the RevokeOAuthTokensAction unprotected, as the impact of a successful attack seems low, the difficulty of attack seems high (requires a token to be known), and it's a little more inconvenient to fix (I believe the JS in the atlassian-oauth repository would need to be changed.)
fields.summary: CSRF in gadgets plugin

fields.description:
Inserting a weblink will try to convert it to either an external link or an internal Confluence link. Not having https, but having a / will turn it into an internal link (even if it's not an existing Confluence page).

See the following table for examples

|Input|Output|
|www.example.com|http://www.example.com|
|www.example.com/hello|http://baseurl.com/www.example.com/hello|
|http://www.example.com/hello/|http://www.example.com/hello/|

The second example one would expect the url not to point internally, but keep it external (the user is explicitly trying to insert a web link).
fields.summary: Not using http in a weblink, but having / will turn the web link into a local confluence link.

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce* 
1. Load a page.
2. Click on an image in a comment to load the previewer.
3. Now close the previewer, then click on an image in the main content of a page (assuming you have more than 1 image so that the minimode is present).
4. Open minimode. It will overlap the zoom controls and not rescale the image.
fields.summary: If an image in a comment is clicked on first, minimode will overlap zoom controls

fields.description:
h3. Steps to replicate

# Create two spaces space foo and space bar
# In space foo create a 'Product Requirements' page
# Navigate to the 'Product Requirements' report page
# Move this page to space bar
# Click 'Add Requirements'
# Enter a title for the page and hit save

h3. Result

The following error appears:

The parent page specified does not exist. It may have been renamed or removed since you started editing.

h3. Expected Result

The page should save

Really you shouldn't be able to move the page, because it opens up a plethora of problems and confusion.

h3. Workaround

# Move the child pages out of the Product Requirements report page if there are any
# Remove the Product Requirements report page
# Click Create->Product Requirements in the bar space
# A new Product Requirements report page will be created, and any product requirements pages in that space should be displayed.
fields.summary: Moving a blueprint index page to a new space causes error 'The parent page specified does not exist' when adding new pages of that blueprint type

fields.description:
Please see my screenshot.

I tested on Apple email and Gmail. The bug is more obvious when date lozenge is inside a heading text or big font.
fields.summary: Calendar icon of date lozenge in email is not always centred.

fields.summary: issue-retriever fails with NullPointerException when the underlying AppLink is not present

fields.description:
This is typically occurring after an import and is due to the users being notified by a change not existing, causing a NullPointerException and a transaction rollback. 

In OnDemand, it is reportedly caused by a deletion of user through JIRA OnDemand, which triggers deletion of the user in Confluence OnDemand. In Confluence watch list, this user is listed as _undefined ()_.

We have seen this occur for page saves, page moves, page deletion and comment saving.

       at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor4066.invoke(Unknown Source)
       at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
       at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

As a space administrator, remove the invalid user from the watchers list. See screenshot:

!watchers.png|thumbnail!


This workaround doesn't work for me every time, the deleted watcher will disappear then reappear if I refresh the page. Here's the database queries to take care of it:

{noformat}
select username from user_mapping where user_key in (select username from notifications where contentid = <YOURPAGEIDHERE>);
Hit edit on the page to get this, alternatively if the deleted user is watching the entire space sub the last part for spaceid = <YOURSPACEIDHERE>
{noformat}

With that statement pulled up you can compare to the watchers list on the page. Find the one that's in the SQL but not on the page, that's your culprit.

{noformat}
select user_key from user_mapping where username = '<YOURUSERNAMEHERE>';
** This is the culprit username that doesn't match
{noformat}

If you haven't already make a backup of your connie DB

{noformat}
delete from notifications where username = '<YOURUSERKEYHERE>';
** The user key from the above statement
{noformat}

This will also fix the problem for any other pages not that has that deleted user as a watcher
fields.summary: Notifications for users which no longer exist are preventing page operations
WIki markup for Space/Page Links in Header for Theme Configuration does not work.

fields.description:
Although sporadic, sometimes when users get their names/usernames changed the At mentions feature in Confluence still reflects their previous user information.

Seems to primarily happens with large Confluence instances as it takes some time to Confluence update the user cached information.

A Content Indexing solves the problem.
fields.summary: At mention users in Confluence do not always find users who had their names/usernames recently changed.

fields.description:
Due to the usage of 'tiny links' the embedded links within images created by Gliffy in an installed instance are unable to be migrated to an OnDemand environment.

*Improvement:*
An improvement to the process would be:
* Develop a migration task for tiny-links to ensure availability on the target OnDemand instance
fields.summary: Gliffy links are not maintained when migrating from installed to OnDemand

fields.description:
When focused on a page within page-tree there are three behaviours that can occur.  These appear to be inconsistent.

* Selecting a page "Under Scroll 2" for focus  
* When using the child-expand link per the image - the first time it will autofocus to the 'Under Scroll 2' link.
* If you minimise the child-expand and repeat the action. the autofocus behaviour no longer occurs
* Selecting a different child-expand link (above the focused page) - the first time will cause the autofocus
* Selecting a different child-expand link (below the focused page) will never cause the autofocus behaviour

The behaviour is expected to be consistent

fields.description:
This issue is happening on OD since OD-37
Steps:
- Page need to have scrollbar
- Open preview of a file
- Upload a new version, there are several ways you can make it fail: Upload a file exceed limit, or cancel during upload,...
- Close preview

Error:
- the scrollbar of a page disappear

This issue will definitely be fixed before release of 5.7

# create or edit a Confluence page;

fields.description:
If any space have a promoted user template, when the top 'Create' button is pressed, the list of available templates never stops loading, or it creates a blank page directly (using the 'Blank Page' template)

h3.Steps to reproduce:
# Create a new template to a space
# Click the 'Promote' link to promote it
# Return to Confluence's home page
# Click the 'Create' button on the top of the screen

h3.Workaround:
Unpromote the promoted user templates.

# Open Macro Browser

fields.description:
We found this bug by having the following problem:

We couldn't mention an *specific* user (doris.doppelbauer) within Confluence by using @user while creating or editing a page.

We found a Explanation (see link at the end), which isn't working in our case, because the user appears in the people directory *four times*, while the link to the Profile itself is always the same. The search for this user won't give aus any results.

I checked the rights and roles and in my opinion everything is alright. The user is able to watch the spaces but nobody can mention this user.

I made some screenhots in order to make you able to see the problem. 
If you have any further questions, please go ahead and ask me. Please fix this issue as soon as possible, as we need to mention users for our workflow.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ONDEMANDKB/Existing+Users+do+not+Appear+in+Confluence+People+Directory,+Team+Calendars,+Share+Feature+and+Watchers+List
fields.summary: Confluence onDemand: User Multiple in Peoples Directory - not able to mention User on an Page

fields.description:
We are on the Cloud-based version of Confluence and I'm trying to organize our Categories list more effectively. I've removed the category "teams" from all associated spaces, yet it continues to display in the CATEGORIES list.  And if you click on it it shows "No spaces found". 
My understanding from the online documentation is that a Category should not appear in the CATEGORIES section of the Space Directory (see attachment) if it is not associated with any spaces.
fields.summary: Confluence Space Directory - Categories List displaying a category not associated with any space

fields.description:
Confluence LucidChart embedding seems broken.

Scenario:

 - created document #1 with an embedded LucidChart A
 - created document #2 with an embedded LucidChart B
 - copied (duplicated) document #1 as document #3. Preview shows #1 having an embedded (copy of?) LucidChart A (as expected)
- Clicking on "Edit chart" (previewed as A) within document #3 - Lucid chart opens chart B!

It appears that preview images and the actual embedded document get out of synch. It is also not clear if copying a Page means duplication of embedded LucidChart documents or just references to them. Given that most charts and up being based on other existing charts, lack of clarity as to which way it works is a real confidence & productivity killer.
fields.summary: LucidChart embedding: chart preview does not match chart document

fields.description:
After the upgrade from 5.1-OD-13 to 5.2-OD-3 on July 8, 2013 the Daily update email shows all users as Anonymous.

The following text shows in the email:
{{Page: Example Page! created by Anonymous [12:05 AM]}}

*A fix for this will be available 29th July 2013*
fields.summary: Confluence changes in the last 24 hours email shows users as anonymous.

confluence crash on setup database stage and produce crash stack:

Used pptx embedding macro but failed and was instructed to create an issue here.
fields.summary: Confluence On Demand unable to embed viewable pptx

fields.description:
Previously the entries in the Table of contents macro in Confluence consistently displayed the full text of a heading in the page. Since mid-October customer's are seening TOC entries truncate unexpectedly.

Truncated TOC entries coincide with the following situations
# Heading contains a hyperlink (including those automatically generated by Confluence around text that matches a JIRA issue ID)
# Heading contains ": "
# Heading contains styled text (e.g. italic, color applied to part or all of heading)

*Heading truncates at end of auto-generated hyperlink*
*Steps to reproduce*
# Add a TOC macro to a confluence page
# Add a heading to the page
## Include text that matches a JIRA ticket ID in the heading
# Save the page
*Expected behavior*
The heading text appears in the TOC in its entirety
*Actual behavior*
The heading text in the TOC truncates at the end of the hyperlinked text in the original heading

*Heading truncates at ": "*
*Steps to reproduce*
# Add a TOC macro to a confluence page
# Add a heading to the page
## Include ": " in the heading text
# Save the page
*Expected behavior*
The heading text appears in the TOC in its entirety
*Actual behavior*
The heading text in the TOC is truncated where ": " appears in the original heading

*Heading in TOC truncates at styled text*
*Steps to reproduce*
# Add a TOC macro to a confluence page
# Add a heading to the page
## Italicize or otherwise style a portion of the heading text
# Save the page
*Expected behavior*
The heading text appears in the TOC in its entirety
*Actual behavior*
The heading text in the TOC is truncated where the styled text begins in the original heading
fields.summary: Table of contents macro entries truncate before the end of the heading text

fields.description:
After the release of the new header for Confluence, if the Top Bar is set to white then the Confluence icon, and therefore the application navigator, is invisible (as the text in the icon is white). It's not possible to customise this text as it's an image. In addition work box is invisible.

Screenshot of the header with a white Top Bar below:
!Screen Shot 2012-10-17 at 11.35.00 AM.png!
fields.summary: If top bar is set to white the Confluence logo is invisible

fields.description:
# Create a page title with no international characters.
# Create a page title with international characters (example, š)
# Link both pages on a new page.
# Save.
# Edit title of both pages,
# Check page with links.
# You will see the one without international characters was updated.

h4. Workaround
Manually re-connect the links and it will be updated.
fields.summary: Linked Page Titles Do Not Update Automatically When Containing International Characters

fields.description:
The {{UploadAttachmentsAction}} action is declared to use a {{validatingStack}} interceptor chain, but does not use the {{RequiresSecurityToken}} element, leaving it open to an XSRF attack. If this were exploited, an attacker could force a user’s browser to upload files into a space they have write permission in.

File:confluence-misc-plugin\confluence-attachments-plugin\src\main\resource\Atlassian-plugin.xml

{code:xml} 
<xwork name="Attachments Plugin Actions" key="attachments.actions">
  <package name="Page actions" extends="default" namespace="/pages/plugins/attachments">
...
  <action name="uploadattachments" class="com.atlassian.confluence.extra.attachments.actions.UploadAttachmentsAction">
    <interceptor-ref name="validatingStack"/>
    <result name="input" type="json"/>
    <result name="error" type="json"/>
  </action> 
{code}
fields.summary: UploadAttachmentsAction XSRF

fields.description:
If a custom Homepage has been set for the Confluence instance, going to any Administration panel that requests the 'Administrator Access Dialog' and then clicking Cancel will return the user to the Default Dashboard, rather than the homepage that has been selected.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Set a custom dashboard via Confluence Admin -> General Configuration -> Site Homepage
# Drop the admin access again
# Go to the Confluence Adminstration panel (you will be shown the Authenticate page)
# Cancel the Administrator Acess prompt
# You are back on the system dashboard
fields.summary: When a custom Homepage is set the Administrator Access dialog will not return you to it

fields.description:
Macros from the [Advanced Tables for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/org.swift.confluence.table] add-on don't work initially when a new customer signs up for a Confluence Only instance and chooses the Advanced Tables add-on during the sign up process. 

*Steps to Replicate*
1. Sign up for a new OnDemand evaluation at https://www.atlassian.com/ondemand/signup/
2. Select *confluence* and *advanced tables for Confluence* on the initial configuration screen. 
3. Wait for your instance to be provisioned. 
4. Login and try to add the {noformat}{table-plus}, {csv}, {json-table} or {attachment-table}.{noformat} to a page. 
5. The plugin cannot be enabled via the *manage add-ons* menu in OnDemand.
fields.summary: Advanced Tables macros do not work on new Confluence-Only instances

fields.description:
h5.Steps to reproduce:

- Go to YouTube and grab an embed link for a video, for example (www.youtube.com/embed/XvolhvLECPc).
- in a Confluence page, insert a widget connector macro, and paste the above URL.
- You will end up with a broken image and no player is shown:

!youtube.png!

h5. Workaround:

Just grab the normal link from the YouTube link on the browser, which looks something like (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XvolhvLECPc).

fields.description:
This is Confluence on an OnDemand instance.

It looks like there's no way to get the rendered output of a page tree macro through the REST API. Is this correct?

I get back some hidden input fields, and it looks like in Confluence, the loading and rendering of the page tree is done by JavaScript / Ajax by using those fields.

fields.description:
*Problem:*
Task List disables sidebar content to Anonymous users when one or more items are inserted to the list.

*Diagnosis:*
Sidebar content is visible when viewing the page logged in.
Sidebar content is visible with Anonymous login if Task List macro is empty.
As soon as one item is inserted in the Task List, sidebar disappears.

Affects Confluence 'Dynamic Task List 2 Plugin' version 4.2.1
Wasn't happening in 'Dynamic Task List 2 Plugin' version 4.1.7

*Steps to reproduce:*
# enable anonymous login to confluence
# verify that the default theme is configured for the space
# create a page with an empty task list macro
# open the page in a new browser (anonymous session)
all good:
!Task_List_test_1.jpeg!
we see the empty task list and the sidebar with content
# with the login session, add one item to the list
# refresh the anonymous browser
the sidebar content is missing:
!Task_List_test_2.jpeg!
fields.summary: Task List disables sidebar content to Anonymous users

fields.description:
Steps to replicate:
# Go to Confluence Administration
# Go into General Configuration
# Click edit
# In the site welcome message add the following text:

{noformat}
{note}
* Bullet point should be here
* [this is a link|http://www.google.com]
{note}
{noformat}

Result:
Wiki markup inside the note macro does not render correctly

Expected Result:
The bullet points should appear, and the link should render correctly

Workaround:
Take the wiki markup out of the notes macro

As per [the below comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-27244?focusedCommentId=416580&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-416580] this is the case in the documentation theme configuration as well.
fields.summary: Info, Warning and Notes macros in site welcome message or theme configuration not rendering wiki markup in their body

fields.description:
After weekly maintenance, some OnDemand customers are reporting that certain Confluence system Macros are not working such as *dashboard macros* and *basic macros*

It may be possible to enable the macros via the add-ons menu in confluence, however sometimes a restart is needed. 

h4. workaround

Restarting Confluence resolves this issue.
fields.summary: Confluence macros not working with error: 'Unknown macro: { }'

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create a Template with a variable;
# Set the variable to _List_ and define available values;
# Copy the variable to clipboard and attempt to paste it into another template - it'll be set to _Text_ and the list of values will be lost.

This doesn't happen when a variable is copied within the same template.

*Use case:*
There's no feature for copying Templates between Spaces, so copy+paste can be used as a workaround. Variables should be copied properly in the process.
fields.summary: Variable list values are lost after copy-pasting the Template

fields.description: I have removed about 600 pages in our OnDemand Confluence. But all the old labels are still there, even though no pages are referring to them. I have purged the trash in all spaces. And I have also tried to reindex from admin.
fields.summary: Labels do not disappear even though no pages are reffering to them

- Choose (Shared Links).

!sharelink1.png|thumbnail!

For the preview image to be included in the page body.

fields.description:
The current active license count appears to show only within the License Details page in Confluence-only instances, which regular customer administrators are unable to view. This means they can't get a proper count of how many free license slots they have.

h3. Workaround:
The License Details page can be reached directly via the following URL: *example.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/license.action*
fields.summary: Regular administrator users cannot see user license count in Confluence-only OnDemand instances

fields.description:
The cog menu item directing to the user management screen seems not be uniform in Confluence OnDemand:
- _User Management_ in a Confluence-only instance;
- _Global Users_ in JIRA+Confluence.

In JIRA it's _User Management_, so for a JIRA+Confluence instance, this appears quite messy.
fields.summary: Non-uniform naming of the admin menu item: "User Management" or "Global Users"

fields.description:
Using Soap API (Tested with Product Integration), user can be deactivated (the active flag on cwd_user table is set to F).

This has caused log in issue for the OnDemand instances since we do not utilize this feature. We use group assignment to allow customers for application access. And it should be restricted as per the our official documentation:

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Restricted+Functions+in+Atlassian+OnDemand

Once the flag is set to 'F', the user can no longer log in even given application access. But from the UI level, it is almost impossible to tell that user is actually deactivated.

And user is unable to activate back without assistance from support if they intend to perform from our end.
fields.summary: SOAP API Allows the User to be De-Activated on OnDemand

If you are using Chrome, you will get an error to install Adobe Flash (even if you have it installed), and this happens on Windows, Linux, Mac.

If I try to escape the string (e.g. /CVN-77/) the text no longer gets turned into a hyperlink, but the slashes are visible.

fields.description:
Labelling attachments it doesn't matter if you insert the label as uppercase or lowercase.
But when you filter, within Attachments macro settings, for a label by writing it uppercase, the macro doesn't return any results.

h4.Steps to reproduce
# Add some attachments to a page
# Label these attachments
# Add the Attachments macro
# Populate the macro's _*Attachment labels*_ field with an existing label, but write it uppercase.

h4.Workaround

!issue-navigator.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
On Confluence, adding the JIRA Issues macro to a page with a text custom field being shown as a column, and this text field having special characters within the text, let's say the quote sign, the macro displays the character HTML code instead the character itself. It also displays break HTML code instead of the new line.

Save the page

fields.description:
We are using Confluence On Demand. When trying to share a Confluence page with another user, some users do not appear in the auto-complete drop down list. Fiddler shows that queries for these users are returning HTTP 500 errors.

I've attached the HTTP traffic for three queries: One for "will" which is successful and returns our user named William. Two more are attached searching for "eric" and "matt", both of which return HTTP 500. We have users named Eric and Matt, so there should be results from these queries.

As far as I'm aware, this means we cannot share pages with these users. Even if I type the complete username of these users, the Share button will not let me share with them.
fields.summary: "Share" link returns HTTP 500 for some queries

1. Create a comment on any page.

This is hiding the functions "Reply, Edit, Delete, Like" and the date/time of the comment that normally goes with each comments. See picture attached.

This bug happens only in the *Comment field*. It does not occur when inserted on the main page field.

As a workaround, remove the offending attachments via filesystem, or replace with a simple file. The offending attachments can only be reattached as a different form e.g. zipped file.

fields.description:
If a non-admin user browses to a admin page in OnDemand, the get a redirect loop.

This is caused by Confluence sending them off to the login screen. In non-à la carte cases, this is fine, as the login screen has some smarts allowing it to identify that although the user has a valid session, they are not authorised to view the page they tried to, and as such a sensible message is displayed.

In OnDemand, however, we intercept the redirect to the login page and send them off to Indra. Part of Indra's behaviour is that if someone arrives on the login page _and_ they have a valid session _and_ they have a destination URL in the query string, they will be immediately redirect to the destination URL. This means that they get sent back to the page they couldn't view, still as the user who can't view it, and we lose.

JIRA gets around this problem by including a {{permissionViolation}} parameter in the query string, allowing us to identify this scenario and no automatically redirect the user to the destination URL. Would it be possible for Confluence to do the same thing as JIRA here?
fields.summary: Non-admin users attempting to access admin resources find only a redirect loop

fields.description:
The Contributors Summary Macro will not show the correct data in OnDemand.
Possible symptoms are:
* Macro shows contributions from entire space instead of the page
* The amount of comments is inaccurate
* The amount of edits in inaccurate
* Some users are missing from the table entirely
* Reindexing does not change the table to the correct numbers

There is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Contributors Summary Macro is inconsistent in OnDemand

fields.description:
The Editor will display a seemingly empty page when trying to edit a page with a very specific format of macros. The editor is actually displayed underneath the visible screen and requires scrolling to get to. Save and Cancel buttons do not work when it's displayed this way.

!editorbug.png|thumbnail!

Refreshing the Editor once it's loaded once will display the page for editing properly, however each time the page is edited the first load will be displaying incorrectly.

*Steps to Reproduce*

The page needs to have this structure of macros in it.

!structure.png|thumbnail!

# Create a Section *macro*
# Type some text
# Click the 'bulleted list' button. 
# Enter a new line with some text
# Enter new line
# Now type \{expand} to insert an expand macro
# Enter some text inside the expand macro
# Put your cursor back on the empty line before the expand macro, and type some text then hit enter
** The Cursor will now jump beyond the Expand Macro
# Save the page. 
# Edit the page again
** The editor screen is now broken

*Workaround*
To be able to edit the page normally, Edit the page and reload your browser, the Editor will now be shown properly.
Then remove the Bulleted list from the Expand Macro blocks. You will need to reinsert the expand macro as the expand macro will not work correctly until removed and reinserted.
fields.summary: An Expand macro in a Bullet Pointed List inside a Section breaks the Editor
